content: Why would Colin Powell stoop to try to lead the Republican Party while it is in the throes of death. If he doesn't become a Democrat he could join the Libertarians who will oppose the Democrats in the future. I'm sure grateful that the Democrats who lead our Country are so dedicated to doing what's best for us in the way of social justice,a fair tax system with prosperity for all and leading us in the fight against global warming. When the Republicans controlled the Congress from 1994 until more recently did they balance the budget or lead with integrity? No, they all were hypnotized by Rush Limbaugh who misled them to all become evil. I mean how else would they have ended up nominating the illiterate George W. Bush? Take pity on those poor misinformed Republicans like Newt Gingrich. Why he doesn't even have a Law Degree. How could he have become a Law Maker who could deal with intellectual heavyweights like President Clinton who balanced the Budget and restored confidence in our Nation? I feel also feel sorry for Dick Cheney who has obviously not been exposed to the truth of what the world has been dealing with because of Rush Limbaugh. And what about Rush Limbaugh? What Agency appointed him to such a prominent role of telling us what to think? All I've heard about Rush Limbaugh is that he was somehow a sports commentator before he burst onto the World Stage. And now he has finally stepped down as leader of the Republican Party and is offering the job to Colin Powell. This is so surreal. This message has been edited. Last edited by: billford1, Sun 24 May 2009 06:39 PM

content: 'http://abcnews.go.com/Politics/story?id=7667369&page=1' The trouble with this report is that they keep playing the loop of "I won". You want more people to address the Parties shortcomings, then forget about the Democrats and get back to basics. "Powell finds himself in the middle of an increasingly bitter family feud over how to bring the GOP back to life" I still haven't heard him say what should be done. He should know that you can't generalize after being a General. You don't bring his problems, you bring him solutions. "You can only do two things with a base: you can sit on it and watch the world go by or you can build on the base." There's the problem Mr Powell, now what's the solution? Karl Rove thinks that there's room for Mr Powell in the GOP... "lay out his vision, and then back it up by finding people share it and working like heck to get them." Colin Powell: Still a Republican? Perhaps but he's not bringing any solutions to the table. If he wants to help put feet (a base) to those words and then I might consider his propositions as valid.

content: quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: He's openly stated that Americans want bigger government, and are more than willing to pay higher taxes. apparently he was correct. So how does stating that make him a RINO? Conservatives support lower taxes and a smaller government. Conservatives believe lower taxes create more incentive for people to work, save, invest, and engage in entrepreneurial endeavors. Money is best spent by those who earn it. Liberals and Powell support higher taxes and a larger government. Liberals believe high taxes enable the government to do good and create jobs. Liberals need high taxes for social welfare programs, to provide for the poor, etc. Liberals believe we can’t afford to cut taxes. Powell is a RINO. "The World's Finest"
quote: Originally posted by karlhungusjr: quote: He's openly stated that Americans want bigger government, and are more than willing to pay higher taxes. apparently he was correct. So how does stating that make him a RINO?

Money is best spent by those who earn it. Liberals and Powell support higher taxes and a larger government. Liberals believe high taxes enable the government to do good and create jobs. Liberals need high taxes for social welfare programs, to provide for the poor, etc. Liberals believe we can’t afford to cut taxes. Powell is a RINO. "The World's Finest"
